headline: Trump Links Autism to Use of Tylenol During Pregnancy. Kenvue Stock Hits Record Low.
summary: Tylenol maker Kenvue ‘strongly disagrees’ there is a causal link between acetaminophen use during pregnancy and autism.

content.title: Trump Links Autism to Use of Tylenol During Pregnancy. Kenvue Stock Hits Record Low.
content.summary: Tylenol maker Kenvue ‘strongly disagrees’ there is a causal link between acetaminophen use during pregnancy and autism.

headline: Kenvue Stock Hits All-Time Low, Turns Higher After-Hours
summary: Shares of consumer healthcare firm Kevnue dropped to a record low during regular trading Monday, then made up some ground afterhours as President Trump warned that acetaminophen, the active ingredient in Kenvue's Tylenol, is a potential cause of autism.  Kenvue shares were down 7.5% Monday, putting them down about 23% since the company's IPO shortly before its subsequent spinoff from Johnson & Johnson in mid-2023.  Kenvue stock hit a record low and was the worst performer in the S&P 500 Monday.

content.title: Kenvue Stock Hits All-Time Low, Turns Higher After-Hours
content.summary: Shares of consumer healthcare firm Kevnue dropped to a record low during regular trading Monday, then made up some ground afterhours as President Trump warned that acetaminophen, the active ingredient in Kenvue's Tylenol, is a potential cause of autism.  Kenvue shares were down 7.5% Monday, putting them down about 23% since the company's IPO shortly before its subsequent spinoff from Johnson & Johnson in mid-2023.  Kenvue stock hit a record low and was the worst performer in the S&P 500 Monday.

headline: Heard on the Street Recap: Even Tylenol Can’t Cool This AI Fever
summary: Nvidia makes a bullish bet on OpenAI.  The chip giant said it would invest up to $100 billion in OpenAI so that the company can build data centers using Nvidia systems to train and run its next generation of models.  Nvidia's shares rose 4%, adding nearly $170 billion to its market capitalization.

headline: These Stocks Moved the Most Today: Oracle, Nvidia, Metsera, Pfizer, Kenvue, Tesla, Anywhere Real Estate, and More
summary: Stocks climbed on Monday, building on record highs set by the three major U.S. stock market indexes last week.  Oracle  gained 6.3% after a senior White House official said a joint venture would be formed to manage a U.S. version of TikTok.  The venture will be owned by a mix of U.S. and global companies that are already invested in ByteDance, TikTok’s Chinese owner, and newcomers that include Oracle, which will keep providing cloud services for the app.

content.title: These Stocks Moved the Most Today: Oracle, Nvidia, Metsera, Pfizer, Kenvue, Tesla, Anywhere Real Estate, and More
content.summary: Stocks climbed on Monday, building on record highs set by the three major U.S. stock market indexes last week.  Oracle  gained 6.3% after a senior White House official said a joint venture would be formed to manage a U.S. version of TikTok.  The venture will be owned by a mix of U.S. and global companies that are already invested in ByteDance, TikTok’s Chinese owner, and newcomers that include Oracle, which will keep providing cloud services for the app.

headline: Tylenol-maker Kenvue’s stock has lost a quarter of its value in 6 months as momentum grows for autism link despite repeated denials
summary: Kenvue rebuked claims of a connection between autism and acetaminophen and said it is “deeply concerned with the health risk this poses for expecting mothers.”

content.title: Tylenol-maker Kenvue’s stock has lost a quarter of its value in 6 months as momentum grows for autism link despite repeated denials
content.summary: Kenvue rebuked claims of a connection between autism and acetaminophen and said it is “deeply concerned with the health risk this poses for expecting mothers.”

headline: Kenvue Stock Sinks Ahead of Trump Announcement Tying Autism to Tylenol Use During Pregnancy
summary: Shares of Tylenol maker Kenvue dropped Monday ahead of an anticipated announcement by the Trump administration linking pregnant women’s use of the painkiller to autism.

content.title: Kenvue Stock Sinks Ahead of Trump Announcement Tying Autism to Tylenol Use During Pregnancy
content.summary: Shares of Tylenol maker Kenvue dropped Monday ahead of an anticipated announcement by the Trump administration linking pregnant women’s use of the painkiller to autism.

thumbnail.caption: Justin Sullivan / Getty Images Tylenol maker Kenvue said that scientific studies showed that there was no link between acetaminophen and autism.

headline: Oracle, Pfizer & Metsera, Kenvue: Trending tickers
summary: Here are some of the stocks on the move on Monday, Sept. 22. Oracle (ORCL) named Clay Magouyrk and Mike Sicilia as co-CEOs. They will replace Safra Catz, who will become the board's executive vice chair. Pfizer (PFE) is buying Metsera (MTSR), a company developing obesity drugs, for $4.9 billion. Shares of Kenvue (KVUE) are falling following a Washington Post report that the Trump administration will link Tylenol to autism. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

Pfizer (PFE) is buying Metsera (MTSR), a company developing obesity drugs, for $4.9 billion.

Shares of Kenvue (KVUE) are falling following a Washington Post report that the Trump administration will link Tylenol to autism.

headline: Kenvue stock falls after report of Trump admin linking Tylenol to autism
summary: Investing.com -- Kenvue (NYSE:KVUE) stock fell 5.5% in pre-market trading Monday following a Washington Post report that the Trump administration plans to announce concerns about a potential link between Tylenol’s active ingredient and autism risk.
